title: Fundamentals of French
description: First quarter of first-year French in a hybrid format. Students are taught to conceptualize in French as they learn to understand, read, write, and speak. Classes are conducted entirely in French.

title: Intensive Fundamentals of French
description: Intensive first half of first-year French. Students are taught to conceptualize in French as they learn to read, write, and speak. Students develop an awareness of and sensibility to French and Francophone life and culture through reading, viewing, and discussion.

title: Accelerated Fundamentals of French for Spanish Speakers
description: Accelerated first half of first-year French for Hispanophone students. Teaches conceptualizing in French while learning to read, write, and speak using knowledge of Spanish. Develops awareness of and sensibility to French and Francophone life and culture through reading, viewing, discussing.
prerequisite: Two years of high school Spanish, one semester of college Spanish, or heritage speaker of Spanish.

title: Fundamentals of French
description: First quarter of first-year French in a hybrid format. Students are taught to conceptualize in French as they learn to understand, read, write, and speak. Classes are conducted entirely in French.
prerequisite: FRENCH 1A. FRENCH 1A with a grade of C or better
overlaps with: FRENCH S1AB, FRENCH S1BC, FRENCH 1AB, FRENCH 1BC, FRENCH 1ABSP, FRENCH 1BCSP.

title: Intensive Fundamentals of French
description: Intensive second half of first-year French. Students are taught to conceptualize in French as they learn to read, write, and speak. Students develop an awareness of and sensibility to French and Francophone life and culture through reading, viewing, and discussion.
prerequisite: FRENCH 1AB or FRENCH 1B or FRENCH S1AB. FRENCH 1AB with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 1B with a grade of C or better. FRENCH S1AB with a grade of C or better. Placement into FRENCH 1BC is also accepted.

title: Accelerated Fundamentals of French for Spanish Speakers
description: Accelerated second half of first-year French for Hispanophone students. Teaches conceptualizing in French while learning to read, write, and speak using knowledge of Spanish. Develops awareness of and sensibility to French and Francophone life and culture through reading, viewing, discussing.
prerequisite: FRENCH 1ABSP or FRENCH 1AB or FRENCH S1AB or FRENCH 1B. FRENCH 1ABSP with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 1AB with a grade of C or better. FRENCH S1AB with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 1B with a grade of C or better. Two years of high school Spanish, one semester of college Spanish, or heritage speaker of Spanish.

title: Fundamentals of French
description: First quarter of first-year French in a hybrid format. Students are taught to conceptualize in French as they learn to understand, read, write, and speak. Classes are conducted entirely in French.
prerequisite: FRENCH 1B. FRENCH 1B with a grade of C or better

title: Intensive Fundamentals of French
description: First half of first-year French in an intensified form and hybrid format. Students are taught to conceptualize in French as they learn to understand, read, write, and speak. Classes are conducted entirely in French.

title: Intensive Fundamentals of French
description: Second half of first-year French in an intensified form and hybrid format. Students are taught to conceptualize in French as they learn to understand, read, write, and speak. Classes are conducted entirely in French.
prerequisite: FRENCH S1AB or FRENCH 1B or FRENCH 1AB or FRENCH 1ABSP. FRENCH S1AB with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 1B with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 1AB with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 1ABSP with a grade of C or better

title: Intermediate French
description: Texts of contemporary literary or social interest provide the focus for more advanced conversation, reading, and composition. Classes are conducted entirely in French.
prerequisite: FRENCH 1C or FRENCH 1BC or FRENCH S1BC or FRENCH 1BCSP. FRENCH 1C with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 1BC with a grade of C or better. FRENCH S1BC with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 1BCSP with a grade of C or better. Placement into FRENCH 2A is also accepted.
restriction: School of Humanities students have first consideration for enrollment. International Studies Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

title: Intensive Intermediate French
description: Intensive first half of second-year French. Texts and films of contemporary literary or social interest provide the focus for more advanced conversation, reading, and composition. Classes are conducted entirely in French.
prerequisite: FRENCH 1C or FRENCH 1BC or FRENCH S1BC. FRENCH 1C with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 1BC with a grade of C or better. FRENCH S1BC with a grade of C or better. Prior high school or college French is recommended. Placement into French 2AB is also accepted.

title: Intermediate French
description: Texts of contemporary literary or social interest provide the focus for more advanced conversation, reading, and composition. Classes are conducted entirely in French.
prerequisite: FRENCH 2A. FRENCH 2A with a grade of C or better
restriction: School of Humanities students have first consideration for enrollment. International Studies Majors have first consideration for enrollment. FRENCH 2B and FRENCH S2AB and FRENCH S2BC may not be taken for full credit.

title: Intensive Intermediate French
description: Intensive second half of second-year French. Texts and films of contemporary literary or social interest provide the focus for more advanced conversation, reading, and composition. Classes are conducted entirely in French.
prerequisite: FRENCH S2AB or FRENCH 2AB. FRENCH S2AB with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 2AB with a grade of C or better. Prior high school or college French is recommended. Placement into French 2BC is also accepted.

title: Intermediate French
description: Texts of contemporary literary or social interest provide the focus for more advanced conversation, reading, and composition. Classes are conducted entirely in French.
prerequisite: FRENCH 2B or FRENCH S2AB. FRENCH 2B with a grade of C or better. FRENCH S2AB with a grade of C or better
restriction: School of Humanities students have first consideration for enrollment. International Studies Majors have first consideration for enrollment. FRENCH 2C and FRENCH S2BC may not be taken for full credit.

title: Intermediate French
description: First half of second-year French in an intensified form. Texts of contemporary literary or social interest provide the focus for more advanced conversation, reading, and composition. Classes are conducted entirely in French. Prior high school or college French recommended.
prerequisite: FRENCH 1C or FRENCH 1BC or FRENCH S1BC. FRENCH 1C with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 1BC with a grade of C or better. FRENCH S1BC with a grade of C or better. Placement into FRENCH S2AB is also accepted.
restriction: FRENCH S2AB and FRENCH 2A and FRENCH 2B may not be taken for full credit.

title: Intermediate French
description: Second half of second-year French in an intensified form. Texts of contemporary literary or social interest provide the focus for more advanced conversation, reading, and composition. Classes are conducted entirely in French. Prior high school or college French recommended.
prerequisite: FRENCH S2AB or FRENCH 2B. FRENCH S2AB with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 2B with a grade of C or better
restriction: FRENCH S2BC and FRENCH 2B and FRENCH 2C may not be taken for full credit.

title: French Peer Tutoring
description: Tutoring Program in which advanced French students provide assistance to students at a lower level. One hour of tutoring per week.
repeatability: May be taken for credit 4 times.

title: Topics in French Culture and the Modern World
description: Introductory course for non-majors. Focuses on France's role in the modern world and its cultural connections to Asia, the Middle East, Africa, Europe, and the Americas. Taught in English.
repeatability: May be taken for credit 3 times as topics vary.

title: Fundamentals of French (with Emphasis on Reading)
description: Designed primarily for students interested in acquiring a solid reading knowledge of French, and to facilitate the understanding and translating of French texts dealing with a variety of disciplines.

title: Introduction to 19th-Century French Literature
description: Fiction, nonfiction, drama, and poetry of the 19th century studied in relationship to a specific literary or historical problem.
prerequisite: FRENCH 2C or FRENCH S2BC

title: Introduction to 18th-Century French Literature
description: Literature and philosophy of the 18th century studied in relationship to a specific literary or historical problem.
prerequisite: FRENCH 2C or FRENCH S2BC

title: Introduction to 20th-Century French Literature
description: Literatures of the French-speaking world studied in relationship to a specific literary or historical problem.
prerequisite: FRENCH 2C or FRENCH S2BC

title: Grammar and Composition
description: Review of grammar taught in FRENCH 2A-B-C. Students gain facility in writing French and increase reading comprehension. Short texts and films are introduced to generate substantive discussion, and multiple short writing exercises are assigned to solidify skills. Formerly FRENCH 60.
prerequisite or corequisite: FRENCH 2C or FRENCH 2BC or FRENCH S2BC. FRENCH 2C with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 2BC with a grade of C or better. FRENCH S2BC with a grade of C or better

title: Topics in Issues in French and Francophone Culture
description: Investigation of an issue of cultural significance in the francophone world through historical documents, literary works, and newspaper articles. Supplemented with films and/or other elements of popular culture. Multiple short writing assignments to solidify writing skills. Formerly FRENCH 61.
prerequisite or corequisite: FRENCH 2C or FRENCH 2BC or FRENCH S2BC. FRENCH 2C with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 2BC with a grade of C or better. FRENCH S2BC with a grade of C or better

title: Translation
description: Introduction to the theory and practice of translation from French to English and English to French. Many opportunities provided to improve skills in writing and comprehension. Formerly FRENCH 62.
prerequisite or corequisite: FRENCH 2C or FRENCH 2BC or FRENCH S2BC. FRENCH 2C with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 2BC with a grade of C or better. FRENCH S2BC with a grade of C or better

title: Topics in the Work World in French
description: A view into the world of work in French. Areas of study include international relations; French administration; and tensions between management and workers. Attention given to vocabulary and grammar of professional interactions in French. Formerly FRENCH 63.
prerequisite or corequisite: FRENCH 2C or FRENCH 2BC or FRENCH S2BC. FRENCH 2C with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 2BC with a grade of C or better. FRENCH S2BC with a grade of C or better

title: Advanced French Language and Style
description: Intended for advanced students who wish to improve their expressive capabilities in French. Review of more nuanced grammar points. Emphasis placed on rhetoric, syntax, and precision. Advanced readings increase comprehension. Formerly FRENCH 64.
prerequisite or corequisite: FRENCH 2C or FRENCH 2BC or FRENCH S2BC. FRENCH 2C with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 2BC with a grade of C or better. FRENCH S2BC with a grade of C or better

title: Topics in 17th-Century French Literature
description: Examines the age of drama and other vibrant forms in French literature of the period.
prerequisite: FRENCH 2C or FRENCH 2BC or FRENCH S2BC. FRENCH 2C with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 2BC with a grade of C or better. FRENCH S2BC with a grade of C or better

title: Topics in 18th-Century French Literature
description: Examines the literature and philosophy of the Enlightenment, the Ancient Regime, Classicism, and/or Revolution.
prerequisite: FRENCH 2C or FRENCH 2BC or FRENCH S2BC. FRENCH 2C with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 2BC with a grade of C or better. FRENCH S2BC with a grade of C or better

title: Topics in 19th-Century French Literature
description: Focuses on the literature of an era that experienced many modernist transformations.
prerequisite: FRENCH 2C or FRENCH 2BC or FRENCH S2BC. FRENCH 2C with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 2BC with a grade of C or better. FRENCH S2BC with a grade of C or better

title: Topics in 20th-Century French and Francophone Literature
description: A study of modern and contemporary literature and culture.
prerequisite: FRENCH 2C or FRENCH 2BC or FRENCH S2BC. FRENCH 2C with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 2BC with a grade of C or better. FRENCH S2BC with a grade of C or better

title: Topics in Francophone Literature and Culture
description: Literature and cultures of the francophone world.

title: Literature and Society
description: In English. Readings of masterpieces of French literature in their social, political, and historical contexts. Requires at least 4,000 words of assigned composition based on French works. Several essays required.
prerequisite: Satisfactory completion of the Lower-Division Writing requirement.
restriction: Upper-division students only. French Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

title: Topics in French Literary Genre
description: Examines the development and transformation of a single genre, such as the poem or the novel.
prerequisite: FRENCH 2C or FRENCH 2BC or FRENCH S2BC. FRENCH 2C with a grade of C or better. FRENCH 2BC with a grade of C or better. FRENCH S2BC with a grade of C or better

title: Topics in French Literature and Culture
description: Study of a theme, movement, or problem crucial to understanding French Literature and Culture.

title: French Cinema
description: Study of a period, movement, or theme in French or Francophone cinema.
repeatability: May be taken for credit 2 times as topics vary.

title: Topics in History and Literature
description: Examines the dialogue between historical events and literary texts.

title: Politics and Literature
description: Examines the role played by politics and ethics in French literature, film, and culture.

title: Topics in Theory and Criticism
description: Advanced study of theoretical and critical texts.

title: Junior/Senior Seminar in French Literature and Culture
description: Required intensive writing course for French majors to explore in depth selected topic in French literature and culture. Students complete major independent research project on topic studied, making use of literary and critical materials in their capstone essay.  In French.
prerequisite: FRENCH 100A and FRENCH 100B and FRENCH 101A and FRENCH 101B and FRENCH 101C. One course from FRENCH 101A, FRENCH 101B, or FRENCH 101C may be taken as a corequisite.

title: Special Studies in French
description: A project proposal is prepared by the student and approved by the faculty member who directs the project. Procedure must be completed by the end of the first week of classes.
restriction: Repeatability: once for M.A. candidates; twice for Ph.D. candidates.

title: Studies in Renaissance Literature
description: Advanced study of a topic in the Renaissance period.

title: Studies in Seventeenth-Century Literature
description: Advanced study of a topic in the 17th century.

title: Studies in Eighteenth-Century Literature
description: Advanced study of a topic in the 18th century.

title: Studies in Nineteenth-Century Literature
description: Advanced study of a topic in the 19th century.

title: Studies in Twentieth-Century Literature
description: Advanced study of a topic in the 20th and 21st century.
repeatability: May be taken for credit 9 times as topics vary.

title: Francophone Literature and Culture
description: Studies in different francophone literatures and cultures (of Canada, the Caribbean, West and North Africa, and Southeast Asia).

title: Studies in Fiction
description: Examines the art of fiction.

title: Studies in Nonfictional Prose
description: Examines non-fictional genres such as the essay and the memoir.

title: Studies in Poetry and Poetics
description: Examines the genre of poetry and theories of poetry.

title: Studies on a Major Writer
description: Focused study of one author.

title: Studies in Theory and Criticism
description: Advanced study of a topic in theory and/or criticism.

title: History and Literature
description: Advanced study of literary works in their historical context.

title: Cultural Studies
description: Examines the theoretical paradigm of cultural studies.

title: Research in French Language and Literature
description: A project proposal is prepared by the student and approved by the faculty member who directs the project. Procedure must be completed by the end of the first week of classes.  Limit: Once for M.A. candidates; twice for Ph.D. candidates.
restriction: Graduate students only. French Majors only.
repeatability: May be taken for credit 2 times.

title: Dissertation Research
description: For graduate students writing a dissertation with a faculty member in French.
restriction: Graduate students only. School of Humanities students only.
repeatability: May be repeated for credit unlimited times.

title: University Teaching
description: For graduate students completing a course on foreign language pedagogy.
restriction: Graduate students only. School of Humanities students only.
repeatability: May be repeated for credit unlimited times.
